pullRequest.body:
This PR adds some elementary results about the prime subfield of a characteristic p field, e.g., size is p, elements are integer multiples of one, and elements are characterized by being fixed by the p-th power map.

---

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

`+ Subfield.roots_X_pow_char_sub_X_bot`
`+ Subfield.splits_bot`
`+ fieldRange_castHom_eq_bot`
`+ instance : Subsingleton (Subfield (ZMod p))`
`+ mem_bot_iff_intCast`
`+ rangeRestrictField_bijective`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
bors r-
Canceled.
These are my last comments, and I've put additional golfs / suggestions of renames in [this commit](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/1f60c33fae773e1fe951924a2c2866d601f92cfd).

Thanks :tada:

bors merge

Thanks for factoring out the Nat proofs. The neg pow lemma is true in general over odd p, not just for rings with char p; the p=2 is the charP special case. But I don't think you need to generalize it further. LGTM

Thanks :tada:

bors merge

I'm not sure why computing the Galois group of finite fields needs this PR; at least the canonical generator of Gal(L/K) [can be defined](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/channel/217875-Is-there-code-for-X.3F/topic/Theory.20of.20finite.20fields/near/496994060) without mentioning the prime subfield. I'm now trying to do a quick proof without the Fintype.card->Nat.card refactor.

Thanks for factoring out the Nat proofs. The neg pow lemma is true in general over odd p, not just for rings with char p; the p=2 is the charP special case. But I don't think you need to generalize it further. LGTM
Will continue after lunch :)
These are my last comments, and I've put additional golfs / suggestions of renames in [this commit](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/1f60c33fae773e1fe951924a2c2866d601f92cfd).
You might as well provide the instance `Subsingleton (Subfield (ZMod p))`
I think it might be better to inline this proof into `instance : Subsingleton (Subfield (ZMod p))`, since `Subsingleton.elim` is syntactically more general / easier to apply than `bot_eq_top`.

proving nat first, then using that. and a rename to mention `mem` instead of `in`
```suggestion
theorem nsmul_one_mem_bot (K) [DivisionRing K] (n : ℕ) :
    n • (1 : K) ∈ (⊥ : Subfield K) := by
  induction n with
  | zero =>
    rw [zero_nsmul]
    exact Subfield.zero_mem ⊥
  | succ i ih =>
    rw [succ_nsmul]
    exact Subfield.add_mem ⊥ ih <| Subfield.one_mem ⊥

theorem zsmul_one_mem_bot (K) [DivisionRing K] (n : ℤ) :
    n • (1 : K) ∈ (⊥ : Subfield K) := by
  rcases n.natAbs_eq with h|h <;>
  · rw [h]
    simpa using nsmul_one_mem_bot K _
```
there's some way of making `Fintype (⊥ : Subfield F)` work directly because it's the computable embedding of `ZMod p` into `F`, but probably not worth working it out here.
This is done [here](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/1f60c33fae773e1fe951924a2c2866d601f92cfd#diff-c4fcfa81ed9650d13d4fdac0853ef14e23b289c026f2295e08b3e1f3303a8c39R595-R597).

similar breakdown into proving Nat first
```suggestion
open Polynomial in
@[simp]
theorem isRoot_neg_iff {p : ℕ} [Fact p.Prime] [CharP F p] {x : F} :
    (X ^ p - X : F[X]).IsRoot (-x) ↔ (X ^ p - X : F[X]).IsRoot x := by
  simp only [IsRoot.def, eval_sub, eval_pow, eval_X, sub_neg_eq_add]
  rw [add_eq_zero_iff_eq_neg', sub_eq_zero, eq_comm]
  refine Eq.congr ?_ rfl
  rw [neg_eq_iff_add_eq_zero, ← add_pow_expChar]
  simpa using Nat.Prime.ne_zero Fact.out

open Polynomial in
theorem nsmul_one_isRoot (p : ℕ) [Fact p.Prime] [CharP F p] (n : ℕ) :
    (X ^ p - X : F[X]).IsRoot (n • (1 : F)) := by
  induction n with
  | zero => simp [NeZero.ne p]
  | succ n ih => simpa [add_pow_expChar] using ih

open Polynomial in
theorem zsmul_one_isRoot (p : ℕ) [Fact p.Prime] [CharP F p] (n : ℤ) :
    (X ^ p - X : F[X]).IsRoot (n • (1 : F)) := by
  rcases n.natAbs_eq with h|h
  · rw [h]
    exact_mod_cast nsmul_one_isRoot (F := F) p _
  · rw [h, neg_zsmul, isRoot_neg_iff]
    exact_mod_cast nsmul_one_isRoot (F := F) p _
```

Maybe we don't need these?
```suggestion
theorem nsmul_one_mem_bot (K) [DivisionRing K] (n : ℕ) :
    n • (1 : K) ∈ (⊥ : Subfield K) := nsmul_mem (one_mem _) _

theorem zsmul_one_mem_bot (K) [DivisionRing K] (n : ℤ) :
    n • (1 : K) ∈ (⊥ : Subfield K) := zsmul_mem (one_mem _) _
```
I have deleted them.

```suggestion
    Function.Bijective (rangeRestrictField f) := (Equiv.ofInjective f f.injective).bijective
```

```suggestion
  rw [← Subfield.map_bot (ZMod.castHom (m := p) dvd_rfl K), Subsingleton.elim ⊥]
```
(⊤ also works)

Also, `Subfield.map _ ⊤` is called `RingHom.fieldRange`:
```
theorem fieldRange_castHom_eq_bot (p : ℕ) [Fact p.Prime] [DivisionRing K] [CharP K p] :
    (ZMod.castHom (m := p) dvd_rfl K).fieldRange = (⊥ : Subfield K) := by
  rw [RingHom.fieldRange_eq_map, ← Subfield.map_bot (K := ZMod p), Subsingleton.elim ⊥]
```

This can go right after `roots_map` in Polynomial/Splits.lean
```suggestion
theorem mem_of_isRoot (F : Subfield K) {f : F[X]} (hnz : f ≠ 0)
    (hf : Splits (RingHom.id F) f) {x : K} (hx : (f.map F.subtype).IsRoot x) : x ∈ F := by
  obtain ⟨x, _, rfl⟩ := Multiset.mem_map.mp
    (roots_map F.subtype hf ▸ mem_roots'.mpr ⟨Polynomial.map_ne_zero hnz, hx⟩)
  exact x.2
```
Renaming to `(Polynomial.)Splits.mem_subfield_of_isRoot` in my commit.

pullRequest.title: feat(FieldTheory/Finite/Basic): lemmas about the prime subfield in positive characteristic
